      Campus
      Senate Votes To Open Applications for CCS & On-Campus Senatorial Vacancies
      June 3, 2019 by Evelyn Spence

      In an attempt to fill two vacant seats within the Associated Students 70th Senate — one of which went unfilled during 69th Senate’s term as well — the Senate voted Wednesday to put out applications for the positions.

      The two seats, a College of Creative Studies (CCS) senatorial seat and an on-campus senatorial seat, were not filled during the Spring Quarter 2019 elections. No student ran for the CCS seat, and only four candidates ran for the five on-campus seats available.  

      The 70th Senate was sworn in two weeks ago. Andrea Verdugo / Daily Nexus

      To be eligible for the College of Creative Studies seat, a student must be enrolled within CCS during the duration of the 2019-20 school year. To be eligible for the on-campus seat, a student must live in a residence hall for the entirety of their term.

      This is the second year in a row that no one has run for the open CCS seat; the last person to hold a CCS seat was Sophia Uemura in the 68th Senate during the 2017-18 school year.

      Due to the two-seat vacancy, there are only 23 senators in the 70th Senate as opposed to the slated 25.

      To fill the seats, the Senate will put out applications “to the UCSB community,” Wednesday’s resolution read.

      The resolution, authored by On-Campus Senator Austin Foreman and Off-Campus Senator Eric Moon, states that any applications received will then be vetted through an ad hoc committee. The committee will be led by Off-Campus Senator Tianna White as chair, Off-Campus Senator Daniel Segura-Esquivel as vice chair and five additional senators who will be chosen at a later date.

      White and Segura-Esquivel will not have voting abilities; the five additional senators will be the only voting members.

      “It is important that these vacancies are filled as soon as possible to ensure that the 70th Senate runs smoothly and is properly able to address the needs and concerns of the constituents belonging in both the College of Creative Studies and the university residence halls,” the resolution states.

      A.S. President Alison Sir, Internal Vice President Alli Adam and a Committee on Committees chairperson will also be non-voting, ex officio members of the ad hoc committee.

      The committee will also reach out to students who have previously inquired about the position to “let them know of the application and interview process,” the resolution states.

      A decision will be made in Week 4 of Fall Quarter 2019 as to who will fill the seats, the senators confirmed at Wednesday’s meeting. The candidates must be approved be at least a 50% plus one vote in the ad hoc committee and a two-thirds approval by the full Senate.

      Print
      Evelyn Spence
